result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shanda Jo Wilk

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: for Release/Modification/Change in Sentence. Approved for 4 days. Signed by RMW on 8/21/2015. km
to REvoke Deferred Judgment of Conviction Agreement. Filed by ADA Hahn. km
filed by Attorney Amann stating ADA Gehler's jail credit summary is correct except for one add'l time period, which he is looking into.

CO: Cameron, RPR: Drost, Clerk: Webb,ADA:  Kevin H. Gehler   DF ATTY:  T Gregory Amann   DF:  Shanda Jo Wilk appeared.  Court called at 4:47 p.m.  Includes case 14CF243, 14CF286, 14CF301, 14CF488, 14CF501 & 14CM305.  ADA Gehler advises the court the State is recommending a 36 month Diversion Agreement.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the court.  DE pleads Guilty to Ct 1 in 14CF243 and Ct. 1 and Ct. 3 in 14CF286.  Crt informs DE of rights. Attorneys stipulate to the facts.  Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly makes plea. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 14CF243 but withholds sentence due to deferred judgment and Ct. 1 and Ct. 3 in 14CF286. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses  but reads in for purposes of restitution Ct 2 in 14CF243 and Ct. 2. in 14CF286 and all counts in 14CF301, 14CF488, 14CF501 & 14CM305.  Court signs the Diversion Agreement.  Court adjourned at 5:17 p.m.  lw

S/W 2 years probation with conditions on Ct. 1 and Ct. 3 on 14CF286
- AODA with follow through
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Report to probation by 12:00 p.m. on 11/24/14
- Court waives all court costs and DE to pay $200.00 for DNA surcharges on Ct 1 and Ct. 3 on 14CF286
- Attorneys send letter to court with jail credit.
- 20 days to appeal
Atty Amann has been appointed counsel for Shanda Wilk. mab

ADDRESS INFO for Shanda Jo Wilk
Current: 803 Wasson Lane #201, River Falls, WI 54022 United States  (Effective: 11-18-2014)
Prior: 610 Oak Street, #1, Baldwin, WI 54002 
per Defendant in court. eif
Preliminary hearing on November 24, 2014 at 10:00 am.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Catherine B.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: TCH for EJL, RPR: Val Deiss, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Kenneth N. Sortedahl,  DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton,  DF:  Shanda Jo Wilk appeared from jail. Includes 14CF501 & 14CF488. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. Waive speedy prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 24, 2014 at 10:00 am.
